title: 103_hr2155
content: The Act aims to enhance the US Government's ability in negotiating arms control treaties, centralize leadership in nonproliferation policy, and improve congressional oversight of the budget for the Arms Control and Disarmament Agency. The amendment in Section 22 of the Act pertains to the appointment of the Director. The Agency shall be headed by a Director appointed by the President with Senate approval. The Director advises on arms control, disarmament, and nonproliferation matters under the guidance of the Secretary of State. The amendment grants the Director permanent membership on the National Security Council. The amendment grants the Director of the United States Arms Control and Disarmament Agency permanent membership on the National Security Council. The Arms Control and Disarmament Act is amended to include a provision for Special Representatives. The Arms Control and Disarmament Act is amended to allow the President to appoint Special Representatives for Arms Control and Nonproliferation, who will hold the rank of ambassador and receive administrative support from the government agency. The Arms Control and Disarmament Act is amended to appoint Special Representatives for Arms Control and Nonproliferation, replacing the previous title. SEC. 4. NEGOTIATION MANAGEMENT. Section 34 of the Arms Control and Disarmament Act is amended to address negotiations and related functions. The Director is responsible for managing US participation in international negotiations on arms control, disarmament, and nonproliferation. This includes preparing instructions, guiding negotiations, and overseeing interagency groups. US representatives in these fields must act under the Director's direction.
